message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a product that I believe would be incredibly valuable to you. Given its potential, I'm proposing an initial offer of $950,000. I'm confident that this is a fair price that reflects the significant benefits it will bring to your operations.

I appreciate your initial offer, but I'm looking to save as much as I can. Considering the product's value is worth no more than $1,000,000 to me, I'm willing to offer $850,000. I believe this is a fair price that still reflects the product's benefits, and I'm willing to negotiate further if needed.

Bob, I understand your desire to find a good deal. I'm confident that this product will exceed your expectations in terms of value.  To move us closer, I'm willing to come down to $920,000. This offer reflects my best effort to find a mutually beneficial agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice. However, I'm still looking to save as much as I can. Considering the product's value is worth no more than $1,000,000 to me, I'm willing to offer $870,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our previous offers and see if we can find a mutually beneficial agreement.
Bob, I appreciate your persistence.  Let's find a middle ground. I'm willing to accept $895,000.  This is my final offer, as I believe it's a fair reflection of the product's value.

I understand that you're willing to meet me halfway, but I'm still looking to save as much as I can. Considering the product's value is worth no more than $1,000,000 to me, I'm willing to offer $880,000. I'm close to your final offer, but I need to make sure I'm getting the best deal possible.
